Marcy Spector wrote:
> Hello,
> 
> We are facing a situation at our company of having to
> create JUnit tests for developed code.  Maybe we
> should have followed a better methodology (which can
> be another email thread), but the situation is we have
> lots of unit testing to write.

I think you need this book: http://tinyurl.com/9j3e9

Rule #1: Don't stop everything to write all those tests. Choose wisely. 
The book helps you learn how.

> What are some ways and/or products to either try to
> automate such a task or implement some best practice
> at this stage?

Agitator can help you learn about the behavior of existing code. Beyond 
that, I haven't found any tools that do an adequate job of automating 
test cases. It's a difficult problem.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com

Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
